website_summaries.verdict: With a rugged design that holds up against rough play and frigid weather alike, this spacious snow tube is an excellent option for sharing the ride with a friend.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the double tube was pretty disappointing. We blew it up and it never laid nice, it is twisted almost like the seams are incorrect. Not fast. Good for our 3 year old who doesn't like to go very fast but super lame for our 5 year old. Spend the extra money and get a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L.

customer_reviews.title: pops quickly
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a sturdy and fun snow slider but it did not last even 3 hours on our backyard hill. There were no sticks and plenty of snow, but still the fun of preschoolers was beyond it's sturdiness. So sad to report this. I do not like plastic hard sleds but must admit truck tire tubes seem the only option.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: good, but not for to young kids, too fast
customer_reviews.text: we have fun with it in snowy days. just remind, too fast...
customer_reviews.author: Jun Xu

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected and kept losing air. Also when fully blown it gets twisted and then hard to sit on it. I would not use it going down the hill.
customer_reviews.author: mothrhoodagift

customer_reviews.title: Needs thicker material
customer_reviews.text: Literally first time the kids used it popped. Granted what ever it hit i am sure was fair for it to pop but would have been ideal to see it made with thicker material. It doesn't look or feel cheep.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Let it snow!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these snow sleds for my kids who are 6 and 9 years old. These are perfect. They inflated quickly with a pump and seem to be very durable. They have built in handles that can easily be held with gloves on. Now we just need some snow on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Held up great .. great price !
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and held up in the snow as well as another brand my sister bought popped after 30 min . Well worth the money since these were only $20 for a two seater :)
customer_reviews.author: Bernice Dimiceli

customer_reviews.title: Good use in 2 out of 4 seasons.
customer_reviews.text: Got good results from using it in the snow and at the pool. Easy to blow up and deflate. Multiple uses in multiple seasons makes it a more logical purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t deflate
customer_reviews.text: We used this instead of the pillows they sell to close the above ground pool. Well worth the money. The pillows deflate this did not.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Hellenbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good tune... was all lob sided when Inflated, then lasted 10 minutes before busted...
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Broke fast
customer_reviews.text: Popped on the second use. My son is 10 years old and within an hour on our second day out it popped, I don't mean it got a hole I mean it exploded. Terrible quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived 2 boys and heavy use!
customer_reviews.text: If it survived a winter on our huge hill in the snow AND a summer in the pool you know it's durable! Perfect for sledding! Easy to blow up. Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We don’t get a lot of snow, but enough we can pull our kids around the yard/sled down the small hill into the neighbors yard. These glide very smoothly on the top of the snow without sinking in like a typical plastic sled.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Too small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than it looks. Barely fit two kids on it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good material for river or snow tubing
customer_reviews.text: Well made and good price. Material seems thick and feels like it will last a few years. Bought this both for summer river tubing as well as snow tubing. So far it’s worked well for summer tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Chan

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot of fun while it lasted. Got ripped wide open by the tip of a tree while we were sledding down the hill. You get a lot of speak with this badboy while going down a slope.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua tyranowski

customer_reviews.title: Its smaller in person than it seems online.
customer_reviews.text: It was great. We got to try it out this weekend and it was durable and fast. The only thing I would say is that its smaller than it looks. If it was bigger it would get a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - kids jumped on it, didn’t pop
customer_reviews.text: Nice sled - impressed with the durability and went fast down the hill!
customer_reviews.author: Carlton W.

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved them
customer_reviews.text: Only problem with this product is one has to inflate often, as air intake plug opens up as kids jump on them or if sledding run is bumpy. But kids loved them.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Easy to blow up and soars across the snow. Our granddaughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: It is better than plastic sleds!
customer_reviews.text: We had a great time with this double snow tube. It is better than plastic sleds.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly made. One trip down a 20 foot hill with my 3 year old and it popped! Very disappointed! My 3 year old cried because it was his first ride on a sled and his Christmas present exploded! Do not waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Walksnice

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Did not last,4 year old went down 3 times and started to deflate..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deflated Winter...
customer_reviews.text: Tube would be fantastic if it held air. I didn't return because my son loved it so much but we had to keep putting air in after ever couple times down the hill.
customer_reviews.author: T Murr

customer_reviews.title: NOPE, didn't work for us!
customer_reviews.text: These might work for very young and small children but they didn't last one day of sledding for my family. Both tubes that we bought popped after 3 runs.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Way smaller than expected, Material is just ok.
customer_reviews.text: This was not as impressive as we expected, This is meant for small children only. The material I don't expect to hold up more than one season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So small not durable
customer_reviews.text: Went snow tubing and it didn’t last even 30 minutes and it’s way smaller than pictures more like a one person
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: No stick or stones lol
customer_reviews.text: Make sure its smooth snow any little thing can pop it but it was fun while it lasted lol
customer_reviews.author: lance davis

customer_reviews.title: Fine for cheap price but not great
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper quality than expected. It’s fine but probably won’t last long
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in the snow. Only used once, but the kids had a blast. They stayed on it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Wayyyy smaller than we anticipated and it deflated instantly unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Chaput

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren had a blast sledding. It held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Trishia starley

customer_reviews.title: Let it snow, Let it snow, Let it snow!
customer_reviews.text: This great snow tube arrived the SAME day as we had a "closed schools, snow day" at my granddaughter's house in Illinois. The timing was great and so is this snow tube. Big hit! Even is you don't have a pump of any kind it is still easy to inflate just blowing into it. Made of high quality freeze resistant materials. Very well made. The handles are strong and do indeed control the direction very easily. It is lightweight so it is quite easy to carry back up the hill. It goes fast too. Comes with repair patches show to need them. Highly recommended by this reviewer and her family
customer_reviews.author: FiFi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: better than foam snowsleds
customer_reviews.text: So excited to try this out this winter! Our family love snow-sledding. However, we only own foam sleds. Getting this 2-person snow tube will definitely add to our family snow fun. And hopefully help our youngest ones feel braver to sled at higher hills, when accompanied by 1 of our older kids or me or my husband. I haven't inflated it yet but have opened it up to check for its size and its plenty big (pic 01). It's 264-lb weight limit is definitely enough for us (pic 02). Can't wait to try it out! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RomRVier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Youngster size!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it is easy to inflate. Has survived intact several play sessions. Handles are sturdy. Lightweight so my grandchild can pull it uphill over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Old Coast Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheap; used once and it popped
customer_reviews.text: This felt cheap from the moment I first touched it... and it was. We used it for just two short (20-foot) runs on the hill next to our driveway and it popped. I think if you have a pristine hill with nothing but powdery snow anywhere in sight you might be able to get an hour or two of use out if it, but I wouldn't expect much more than that. Inflation was moderately easy--we'd inflate it using an electric pump plugged into the car each time--but after a dozen or so times even that didn't work any more (not surprisingly)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonky when blown up
customer_reviews.text: I could not come up with the right word to describe the Franklin Sports Arctic Trails Inflatable Snow Sled except for wonky. When blown up fully, it doesn't remain flat, but instead is wonky or a bit twisted. This is a problem when using it, as even someone lying down on it doesn't allow it to flatten out. It is like the seams are not in the right place. It works okay in that way, but it definitely does not go fast at all. You might want to look for a better made one!
customer_reviews.author: AngieB

customer_reviews.title: Great, but smaller than i thought!
customer_reviews.text: This sled was smaller than i expected. I noticed after the fact it has weight limit of 250lbs, so really it's suited for 2 kids or an adult and a younger child. It's small enough in shape that 2 adults couldn't really fit on it if they tried. It inflated pretty quickly, even though i just blew it up without the help of a pump or anything else. Otherwise, pretty fun. Slides down better than foam sleds for sure. Kids had an absolute ball. Also liked that it compresses down into a TINY, tiny package, which makes it much more convenient than putting a big foam or plastic sled in the car.
customer_reviews.author: j. sistin

customer_reviews.title: Seems Sturdy, A Little Small
customer_reviews.text: We just got this and unfortunately only have a scant inch and a half of snow, but it's early. We did try this out on the small slope of our front yard and we can see the potential for this. Unfortunately it is a little small for adult riders, but our 6th and 7th graders should be able to get quite a bit of fun out of this. I like that it cushions a little bit and the PVC material should hold up well to a good snow pack. The kids are watching the weather to see when they can take this out on a full run!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Newman

customer_reviews.title: There is another use after the snow season, the pool!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to blow up, well... I used an air compressor, only took 15 seconds to get it nice and firm. I like it because it's a nice thick plastic, so I think it will last sometime with out springing a leak. Unlike all our other blow up pool toys that seem to start leaking in a couple of weeks. We plan on using it in the pool all season, if it survives, we will give it a go I the snow next winter. A little on the pricy side I think, the cheap hard plastic sleds we used this last winter were 6 bucks each. But it is a good price for a blow-up sled.
customer_reviews.author: robochick

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: The Franklin Sports Arctic Trails Inflatable Snow Sled is a fun snow tire-like thing for the kids to enjoy on snow days. It requires you to inflate it. You can eithe use a pump, or just blow it up yourself. It’s fairly easy to inflate. It comes with patches in case it springs a leak. The kids actually love this thing. It is small but really the perfect size for kids. It’s easy for them to handle. It’s holding up fine so far. It’s not the best quality, but for the price, it’s fine. It should last a season but I doubt it will survive more than one winter.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Maines, best-selling, award-winning author, actor, and editor

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, filled it with air via my compressor, and went directly to a nearby sledding hill. The tube is very fast and fits an adult or kid on and has two handles. Would not recommend pulling the tube behind anything as it doesn't seem like there is a tow hook or anything for it and is not really designed for that type of thing. BUT if you are just looking to have an afternoon of fun times sledding down a hill then this tube will work perfectly for you.
customer_reviews.author: Fighting Sioux

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but worked ok.  Good for little kids.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this worked ok so no real complaints. I will say it felt a little cheap inflating it. Like, the warnings and markings made me feel like it was something from a dollar store as opposed to say, REI. Do they still exist? Anyhow, it had a pretty light weight limit, so no adults. A kid, maybe two, would work on this. My nieces and nephews enjoyed it, and it slid nicely - didn't break - no worries whatsoever. I was just a little worried cause it felt cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Ride, Durable for Inflatable
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this sled. The inflatable design is very comfortable going down a bumpy hill, compared to traditional hard sleds. In addition to comfort, we found this sled very durable. We were sledding in a hill with thin snow coverage and some bare spots. This sled held up much better than another new sled that got damaged on the bottom. Another bonus of this sled is speed. It slides very easily and effortlessly down snow-covered hills. I highly recommend this sled based upon our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Huse

customer_reviews.title: Fast, speedy sled.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like an inflatable pool raft with handles. It went down the hill fast, though a bit more prone to tipping over. I'ts a big sled, but because it's inflatable, it's compact when deflated to be stored. Because I have a small car, I appreciated being able to have the space to pack this, then inflate at the sledding location. (I keep a tire inflator in my car, just in case.) We had a lot of fun on this.
customer_reviews.author: penguingrooves

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Sports Arctic Trails Inflatable Snow Sled
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a sledding club here in Minnesota so he knows a thing or two about sledding. He says this sled slid nicely and smoothly, was pretty fast, and was easy to inflate and seems durable. He says it is too small for a bigger adult and the handles are too small for adult hands. He thinks an appropriate age range for this sled would be 8-12 but a smaller adult can fit on it. The price is great for the quality and this sled is sure to offer hours of winter fun for kids. He recommends it.
customer_reviews.author: Super Nintendo

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great inflatable sled. It is faster than the plastic sleds we have had the last few years, and way more comfortable to ride on. The handles are plenty sturdy, it is not too hard to inflate (use a pump!) and holds air with no leaks. The material is pretty thick, so this will resist some puncture hazards. Definitely not a good option for a stick and rock laden slope, but anything with deep snow or a bit of grooming it is perfect for.
customer_reviews.author: Osprey

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable sled
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this sled for my brother and his 11 year old daughter who are visiting Boston from the tropics. We haven't had enough snow to break in the sled, so we're planned a road trip to Vermont & New Hampshire to break in the sled. The sled itself is easy to pack, to inflate, and light enough for a child to carry up a hill. It is supposed to be able to hold 250 pounds and is approximately 2 feet wide and 4 feel long.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby at Starting Fresh blog

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this Snow Sled.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota, and we have a lot of snow from Jan till March. Near my place we have a hilly spot where we used this snow sled, my kids loved it and it is more fun. The handles are too good to hold on and a nice grip. By the handles it helps us to control the directions and my daughter was able to go alone in this snow sled.
customer_reviews.author: XNOR

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: I compared this out of the box to a cheap one my sister bought at a drugstore on clearance for $5. They look identical. They took the same amount of time to inflate by a pump. The cheaper one came with a patch. This did not. This one may have been a bit thicker material though. The handles are the same. And the size was the same! It worked just fine, and the kids had fun sledding last weekend.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiChick

customer_reviews.title: Kid tested, didn't pop
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this thing would pop before we ever had a chance to get out onto the slopes (the golf course hill). It did deflate on its own, after a month, but it was just fine when we reinflated it. This sled went down the hill about a dozen times, very fast. The bottom is slick; the round shape doesn't dig in and slow down. I look forward to using it as a river raft this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is basically an inner tube with handles. It can be used in the pool as well as the snow. The main thing I've noticed is that it's quite a bit sturdier than most inflatables. It's held up to a great deal of abuse. It's small, so good for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This snow tube is a lot of fun! I enjoy it more than a sled, as you get a smoother ride and can slide/spin around more. There are handles to hang on to, but you could also use them to tie a rope to pull kids. It airs up fairly easily, though the last bit is hard to do by mouth and it's hard to keep it 100% aired up (instead of 98%). Lots of fun. Durable material, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy - lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This Franklin Sports Arctic Trails Snow Tube Snow Racer got its break-in run the other night in 20 degree weather. The seams on this unit all appear well-made (no erratic seals or off-cuts), and the handles (which are very sturdy) are all on securely. The racer held up very well despite heavy use in the frigid cold. The unit is rated for a max weight of 132 lbs, but I'm sure we exceeded that from time to time. :-) Very study. Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bobinski

customer_reviews.title: Fun For Multiple People
customer_reviews.text: Use this on beaten trails without brush. It is great if used in the right places. It is big and easily fits two to four children. Not as good with only one person...whips. Thick material, will still puncture running into brush. Handles are well designed.
customer_reviews.author: LRK

customer_reviews.title: Holds one big adult very well
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is very thick and sturdy and holds air well. It says two seater, but I imagine it would fit two kids much more comfortably than two adults. I’m a daily heavy adult and it didn’t pop when I sat on it, so I’m impressed by that! It’s still summer here, so I can’t take it down a hill. I will certainly post an update once I’m able to see how she files in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal C Eisenhower

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love it
customer_reviews.text: OMG we just had a slight layer of snow and the kids absolutely love this. It's big enough that the 11 yr old can take his 4 yr old sister with him down the hill. Glides nice and made of heavier, quality vinyl. Of course it will tear if it slides on branches or something sharp, but all in all, it's a great tube. Also light enough for him to pull back up the hill.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Quality matches the price
customer_reviews.text: We inflated this snow tube for the first time and it seemed wonky and cheaply made. It worked well enough for our small children (5 and 7) to use but it didn't seem as high quality or sturdy as other sleds and snow tubes we've used. I'm not sure I can recommend this product completely, though the price is decent, you get what you pay for. It's not very big either.
customer_reviews.author: H. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Used it in our slip n’ slide
customer_reviews.text: This tube is easy to blow up and a good size for up to about an 8 year old. The handles are good but it looses air. That’s probably to be expected with an inflatable tube. We used it on our slip n’ slide and it was pretty comfy. They just soaped it up and then went sailing. We’ll see how it holds up in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Tube does not lay flat
customer_reviews.text: The product pictures make it look like this tube is molded to lay flat but it doesn't. The two plastic sides are sealed together without any tapering/shaping. This causes the tube to sort of fold once inflated. My 6 and 3 year old could still use this down the icy snow piles but I'm not sure how this would work for older children. Given the price of the tube I'd have expected some shaping.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Looks well made
customer_reviews.text: It ships in a small box, but it inflates easily. It's better than the cheapo stuff found at the dollar stores. It reminds me of the inflatable rafts at the water parks, but this one has a closed bottom so you don't get soaked on the way down the hill. I bet it will last few seasons if you let it dry fully before deflating and storing.
customer_reviews.author: Bunson Honeydew

customer_reviews.title: Double Tube!
customer_reviews.text: Snow tubes have been really hit or miss for us recently, with a lot of them having holes in them right out of the box, or having issues right away. So far this one has held up, held air out of the box, and has gotten a few good days of sledding in. My 6 and 8 year old really like that this is double, both taking turns pushing and hopping on.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My kids prefer the inflatable tube sleds over the plastic. They had a blast! 2 kids can fit on a time, very durable and works great! I have a few different sleds from over the years and this seems to be their favorite, I did have to blow air into it a few times which is why I took a star off but my kids definitely feel more comfortable on this type of sled
customer_reviews.author: Lee4kids

customer_reviews.title: Let it Snow
customer_reviews.text: The kids have fingers crossed with hopes of snow as this "Snow Tube", from Franklin Sports, has been thoroughly tested and proven to have seams that should withstand some rigorous activity. It is not as large as, for some reason, I expected, however, the kids aren't of the large variety either.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t gotten to use this yet because we don’t have enough snow right now. It seems like it’s heavy duty and made to last. I’m hoping we will be able to use it during vacation. I am also hopi g it lasts longer than other brands we have purchased. It seems like the other brands only last one season.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B

customer_reviews.title: Slides easily over tough terrain
customer_reviews.text: This arrived just in time for our first blizzard in the mountains this year. Easy to inflate. Rugged and retains air over tough terrain. Easy to carry up the hills with the nice side handles. Plenty of room with the handles to really get a firm hold. Bottom slides great downhill. Also easy to deflate. Just rinse off dirt with a hose.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K. Cornett-McVay

customer_reviews.title: Mostly for kids as it is small.
customer_reviews.text: The Franklin sled is an okay product. It is small, mostly for kids but not for an adult. We used it a couple of times in the past two weeks and it shows wear and tear already. I'm thinking i will get one winter out of this sled. It is kind of cheaply made and definitely not made for rough use. Great for little kids mostly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stroh

customer_reviews.title: snow ready again
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy, inflatables have come a long way and this is clearly part of that learning - it is a thick/heavy plastic that will definitly hold up unless you are doing something crazy like running over pointy things with it. decent size for laying and sledding.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Zolar

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for two six year olds
customer_reviews.text: We have used it a couple times on the small hills in our neighborhood. This sled worked well for two 6 yrs old, who went a little crazy with the fun. The sled got deflated a couple times as it couldn't handle their wrestling. Otherwise, it was mostly ok if used nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kanishk

customer_reviews.title: Cool sled, fun design
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this type of thing when I was a kid. As it is this is great fun even as an adult. Was easy to inflate (even by mouth) and feels sturdy, should last a few seasons at least.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: No Patches Included
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly cheap inflatable tube, but so far it's held air quite well. It doesn't include any patches or additional items for repair. It is a good size/shape for running and sliding down the hill.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: Good for younger kids.
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, easy to carry. Ready in a seconds with electric pump. It is super fast, I love it. The best part is I sled over bumps and my butt/spine didn't hurt at all, unlike in hard sled. I have 4 sleds and this one is my fav.
customer_reviews.author: Bigslacker

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems well made and durable. Was easy to fill up with air with my car air pump. Really fast and also easy to carry with the handles. A lot of fun out in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: H.F.

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports Arctic Trails Inflatable Snow Sled – Snow Tube – Snow Rider – Snow Racer –Lightweight Sled – Freeze-Resistant
feature_bullets: IT’S SNOW-TIMES! - Tackle any hill or slope with ease thanks to this inflatable snow sled. Blaze your own trail with the Franklin Arctic trail and go faster than you ever thought possible!
INFLATABLE SLED - All Franklin snow sleds and snow tubes come with durable handles for added safety and maneuverability, making them great sleds for kids.
SPIN AND SLIDE - Spin, swirl, and slide your way down the slopes. These snow sleds are lightweight enough for easy carrying so you can sled again and again!
FREEZE-PROOF MATERIAL - The long-lasting PVC material is freeze-proof and inflates quickly, so you can hit the snow in minutes and enjoy hours of frosty fun!
DOUBLE OR SINGLE SLED - With its dual-tube design and grip handles, our versatile Arctic Trails double or single-seater sled lets you grab a friend and go.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
